ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I continued my study of the Chinese language from introductory lessons in the first semester. In the second semester, we were able to focus more on complex grammar structures, more common vocabulary, and continuous speaking practice through the Chinese projects. I was able to build off of my foundation from Chinese 110 and begin constructing useful sentences on my own.
Speaking, Listening, and typing Chinese at an impressive level.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course has very strong teaching staff, I liked my teachers from first and second semester despite the two having different teaching styles. The course itself is also engaging as it incentivizes students to experiment with the language on its own. The only weakness would be that, since there is so much content to cover, there are times where the course seems rushed or that some topics deserved a bit more time in-class.

Strength: Teachers provide a lot of room for practice
Weakness: Some professors are way more focused on strictly grading and it pulls away from the fun of learning and developing language skills
Great teachers just a lot of work

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely, this is one of the best classes at Yale. Challenging yet extremely rewarding. My teacher was highly supportive and she has truly changed my life, it was such a beautiful experience as a first year.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. It teaches the Chinese language in a way that I could not find anywhere else. The instructors are very professional, the course material maintains a sense of challenge without feeling overwhelming, and the resources for studying and practicing the language are abundant.
I would recommend this class to someone who really wants to learn Chinese. You will be very shocked by how quickly you learn and start to understand so much in just a semester or two.
Yes but be ready to work hard
